data.name: Faisal Al-Kasim
data.bio: One of the founding members of Al Jazeera, Faisal Al-Kasim began his career over three and a half decades ago when he joined the BBC, preparing and presenting its most famous radio programs in 1989. He then transitioned to work with BBC TV before joining Al Jazeera, where he became widely known through his renowned program 'The Opposite Direction.' Dr. Faisal Al-Kasim excelled in television presentation and was selected by many international magazines as one of the most influential media figures in the world. He has won the Best Arab Journalist Award for many consecutive years.
data.experience: With over 35 years of experience across various branches of journalism. He has delivered lectures at numerous conferences and study centers worldwide. His work includes numerous articles published in newspapers and magazines. He authored a book titled 'Skills for Dealing with Media,' published by the Al Jazeera Media Institute. He has shared the essence of his experience in several training courses at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, focusing on topics such as 'Rules for Successful Media Appearance,' 'Introduction to Television Presentation,' 'Media Interaction Skills,' and 'Presentation Skills.'

data.name: Khadija Bengana
data.bio: Khadija Bengana is one of the most prominent media figures in the Arab world and is one of the founding team members of Al Jazeera Satellite Channel. She has presented many successful programs on Al Jazeera, including 'Beyond the News,' 'Speech of the Revolution,' and 'Sharia and Life.' Additionally, she has conducted a number of interviews and important meetings with prominent political leaders, including the late Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi, former Tunisian President Moncef Marzouki, former French President Nicolas Sarkozy, and many ministers, heads of states, and opinion leaders worldwide. She won the Dubai Excellence Award in 2007 and was ranked as one of the ten most influential women in the Arab world in 2006. In 2015, she was classified as an inspirational Arab media personality.
data.experience: Khadija Bengana has extensive training expertise spanning more than 30 years with various media organizations. She began her career in 1987 with Algerian radio, then moved on to Algerian television, and later worked at Radio Switzerland Internationale before joining Al Jazeera, where she is still employed. Bengana imparts the essence of her professional skills and accumulated expertise in numerous training programs and courses at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, including: Introduction to TV Presentation, Dealing with Media Skills, and Public Speaking Course.

data.name: Mhamed Krichen
data.bio: Krichen is one of the prominent media figures in the Arab world, boasting extensive expertise in television and radio presentation, journalistic writing, and media training. He was a founding member of the Al Jazeera Media Network and has continued to contribute significantly to its success since its inception on November 1, 1996. Additionally, he served as a member of the Board of Trustees of the Committee to Protect Journalists in New York from 2011 to 2021. Krichan's contributions to journalism have been recognized with several awards, including the Best Radio Journalist Award in 1992. Furthermore, he was honored by the late Palestinian President Yasser Arafat for his coverage of the Palestinian cause in 1992 and 1993.
data.experience: Krichan's expertise spans over 40 years, during which he worked in esteemed institutions and various media fields. He served as an Arabic affairs editor for several Tunisian newspapers between 1980 and 1995. He worked as a correspondent for numerous Arab newspapers and foreign radio stations, including Radio Monte Carlo and Radio Netherlands International. Krichan also worked as a presenter at BBC Arabic Television in London before joining the founding team of the Al Jazeera Media Network in 1996, where he currently works. He has contributed a weekly column to Al-Quds Al-Arabi since 1997. He has authored three books: 'And Here Are the Details' in 2021 from Beirut, 'Al Jazeera and Its Sisters' in 2006 from Paris, and finally, 'The Palestinian Liberation Organization: History and Factions' in 1986 from Tunis.

data.name: Ahmed Mansour
data.bio: Mansour is an Egyptian TV presenter and writer, he began his career during his secondary education level through correspondence with newspapers and magazines. Mansour, likewise, kept practicing journalism throughout his university education. After graduation, he contributed to all genres of journalism and media and worked as: an editor journalist, war reporter for press & TV, editing manager, TV program producer, and presenter. He is a daily columnist in the press. He works as a principal presenter and an executive producer with Al Jazeera Media Network for about 18 years and up to date. So far, Ahmed has published twenty-five books, some of which were translated to other foreign languages.
data.experience: He covered the war in Afghanistan between 1987 and 1990, the war in the Balkans (1994-1995) and the war in Iraq (2003-2004). Chief Editor of “Al-Mujtamaa” magazine – Kuwait (1990-1997). Executive program producer and principal presenter with Al Jazeera Channel since 1997 until now. Principal Trainer at Al-Jazeera Media Institute since its foundation up to date. Published 25 books including: 'Story of Fall of Baghdad', 'The Battle of Fallujah', 'Under Fire Barrage in Afghanistan', 'Under Pouring Bullets in Sarajevo'.

data.name: Mahmoud Ahmed Mourad
data.bio: Mr. Mahmoud Mourad is a news reader and program presenter. He is also a trainer in Al Jazeera Media Institute. He has over 20 years of experience in TV work, media training, translation, editing and researching. Top-notch Arabic presentation, editing and localization skills. A member of Egyptian Journalists association and International Press Institute. Ex member of the British National Union of Journalists (NUJ).
data.experience: Principle presenter from February 2010 – present: News reader and program presenter. Trainer at Aljazeera Media Institute. Presenter from February 2008 to February 2010: BBC World- London.
data.education: Bachelor of Political Sciences and Public Administration in 1998 from the Faculty of Economic and Political Sciences – Cairo University

data.name: Eman Ayad
data.bio: Eman Ayad is a Palestinian American, Born in Kuwait, works as a principal News and Program Presenter at Aljazeera Network since 1998. Previously, she worked as a correspondent /presenter for Aljazeera TV from Washington DC before joining the headquarters of the Network in Doha, Qatar. She also worked from the American capital as a News correspondent and producer/presenter of a number of political, social, and medical programs for Dubai TV in the period from 1998-1995. She started her career as a field journalist, program producer/presenter on the Arab network of America TV and Radio station (ANA) in Washington DC from 1995-1993. Eman Ayad has been working in Media for over 22 years, and has conducted interviews with some of the most prominent Arab and International figures. She also covered many important international events such as 11/9, the assassination of Lebanese Ex-Prime Minister Rafiq Al Hariri, two American elections of 2008/2004, and the Arab spring in Tunisia, Egypt Libya, Yemen and Syria. In 2006, she has been awarded as the best Presenter on Arab televisions from the Arab Media Festival in Beirut.
data.experience: More than 20 years of experience in Media, Television and radio presenting, TV corresponding, and journalism.

data.name: Fairouz Ziani
data.bio: Fairouz is a principal news presenter /TV program presenter with Al Jazeera Arabic Channel since July 20, 2000. Fairouz presented various programs on the channel including: “Between the Lines, Only For Women, Beyond the News. She presented Exclusive Interviews and Interview of the with a great number of dignitaries. During her tenure of work with Aljazeera Arabic Channel she aired many special news coverage for locally and off border such as Palestinian Judiciary elections in 2006. Recently she covered US partisan meetings. Also, she presents studio coverage special DayRevolution Talk, Beyond the News, Exclusives, and Meeting today with many personalities. She participated in much internal and external coverage’s along her years of working, such as Palestinian legislative elections in 2006, Eye on Russia, and recently caucuses in the United States, in addition to special coverage from the studio for many wars and disasters and revolutions.
data.experience: Fairouz worked as TV news presenter and editor of the major bulletin at eight o’clock in Algerian TV from 1998 to May 2000. In addition Fairouz held a position as a journalist, investigator and producer of many programs on Algerian TV from 1995 to 1998, presenter and producer of various radio cultural programs and radio from 1995 to 1997. Fairouz joined the institution of media and communication in Algeria in 1998, she offered many training courses in Al Jazeera Training Center including: TV presentation skills, talk show management skills, writing for the newsroom conducting TV debates with politicians. Also, she provided training to colleagues in learning French in the newsroom. Fairouz used to be a columnist in Al Sharq newspaper for several years (stopped because of the busy schedule). Ziani gave lectures in many universities and media colleges: Qatar university, Constantine university in Algeria, institute of media and communication in Casablanca in Morocco.
data.education: Higher Studies in Science & Technology at Houari Boumediene University. Higher Diploma in Public Relations and Marketing from New Horizon Center, Doha in 2004

data.name: Abdelkader Aiad
data.bio: A prominent figure in Al Jazeera's media landscape since joining in January 2001, Abdelkader Aiad has served as a news anchor, presenter for numerous programs, and field correspondent covering various events for the network. Combining television presentation with on-the-ground reporting, Abdelkader has produced reports that have left a lasting impact on Al Jazeera's history. Notably, his coverage of the famine in Niger in 2005 marked a significant milestone and turning point in his career. This coverage earned him the Silver Award at the Al Jazeera Documentary Festival. Abdelkader Aiad has been an integral part of Al Jazeera's success in covering major global events, both political and humanitarian. As a trainer, he has an illustrious history with the Al Jazeera Media Institute, offering sought-after courses such as TV presentation, talk show presentations, and media skills training, both at the Institute and in other countries.
data.experience: 1. In 1994, he began his career as a presenter at Algerian radio. 2. He worked as a field correspondent for Algerian television until 1997. 3. He distinguished himself in his coverage of the siege of Fallujah in Iraq in 2004. 4. His coverage of the sacred occasion of Hajj in 2008 garnered high viewership rates on Al Jazeera screens. 5. He has hosted many of Al Jazeera's most renowned programs, starting with 'Between the Lines,' 'Sharia and Life,' 'More than One Opinion,' 'The Opposite Direction,' and 'Without Limits,' leading up to his current program: 'Beyond the News.' 6. He has conducted numerous private meetings with prominent and influential individuals, perhaps most notably his dialogue with the Taliban Foreign Minister shortly before the events of September 11, 2001.

data.name: Jalal Chahda
data.bio: Jalal Chahda is one of Al Jazeera's most prominent stars and one of the most famous media figures in the Arab world. He joined the Al Jazeera Media Network in February 2011. He presents major news bulletins and some news programs at Al Jazeera, such as Beyond the News and Harvest, in addition to conducting interviews within programs like 'Special Meeting' and 'Meeting of the Day'. From 2017 to 2022, he presented the program 'Without Borders,' featuring discussions with Arab and foreign leaders, presidents, decision-makers, and political figures. He also conducted numerous field news coverages in Gaza, Yemen, Afghanistan, northern Iraq, and Libya. Additionally, he was assigned to cover important and milestone events in local and regional capitals, such as the US elections, the inauguration of US President Joe Biden, and the subsequent storming of the Capitol by supporters of former President Donald Trump in Washington, as well as the Turkish presidential elections and their subsequent run-offs. During his tenure as a trainer at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, Shahda trained a large number of spokespersons and officials at diplomatic and ministerial levels. He also conducted other courses on television journalism and public relations.
data.experience: 1. He began his career in the field of television presentation at the beginning of the third millennium when he joined the Lebanese channel LBC in 2002. 2. In 2004, he moved to the MBC Group in Dubai, where he presented the main news bulletin 'The Ninth' and the program 'Good Morning Arabs.' 3. He has been a principal broadcaster at Al Jazeera since 2011.

data.name: Wassila Oulmi
data.bio: Wassila Oulmi is a senior news anchor and presenter at Al Jazeera Arabic channel, known for her extensive field coverage. She notably reported on the Rohingya tragedy, delivering the first live television broadcast from inside Rohingya minority camps. Wassila is among the select few presenters who ventured into Syria to provide on-the-ground news coverage during the sixth anniversary of the Syrian revolution. Additionally, she has covered significant elections, including the 2022 French presidential elections and the 2023 Turkish presidential elections.
data.experience: Throughout her career, Wassila has collaborated with various media organizations, spanning print journalism, radio, and television. She commenced her career at the Algerian newspaper 'Al-Youm'. Wassila worked in Al-Ahram's office in Algeria as a reporter covering Maghreb affairs, later becoming a correspondent for the Nile News channel. She served as a cooperating correspondent for the London-based newspaper Al-Hayat from Algeria. After relocating to Cairo for studies and work, she became a correspondent for the Algerian newspaper El Khabar and the Algerian state radio from Cairo. Wassila worked as a correspondent for the Iraqi Al-Nahrain TV from Cairo and then as a presenter at Be'ati TV, specializing in environmental issues, before joining Al-Sa'a TV as a presenter for major bulletins. In 2008, Wassila joined Al Jazeera.

data.name: Sami Zeidan
data.bio: For 25 years, Sami Zeidan has trained a large number of anchors, reporters, and producers in prestigious media organizations, including Al Jazeera Media Network, CNN, and NBC. In addition to his work as a trainer, he has worked in television preparation and presentation, and has covered a number of important events in various countries around the world, as well as several sensitive locations such as the White House, the United Nations headquarters, and hotbeds of tension and conflict. In 1999, he won the Excellence in Television Award in the United States. Sami Zeidan has extensive experience, including training, academic work, and television production. He has supervised the preparation and organization of training programs for numerous media professionals in Britain, Asia, and training centers in the Middle East. The training courses he offers encompass several fields, such as writing for television, the art of television interviews, as well as ethics of video editing and the art of public speaking.
data.experience: 1. Principal news presenter and correspondent for Al Jazeera. 2. Presenter of the 'Talk-to-Al Jazeera' program. 3. Presenter and executive producer at CNBC Arabic. 4. Presenter and writer for CNN International.

data.name: Adrian Finighan
data.bio: As an international and UK television news anchor and correspondent, Adrian Finighan has covered nearly every major event of the last 20 years. He has interviewed many high profile politicians, business leaders and newsmakers and, thanks to his work at Al Jazeera, CNN and BBC World is a recognizable face all over the planet.
data.experience: Finighan began his career as a local radio reporter in South Wales in 1983. He graduated first to national radio, appearing regularly on BBC Radio’s 1 & 2, and then to television via the BBC’s Business & Economics Unit presenting, producing and reporting for programmes such as Business Breakfast and World Business Report. In 1996 he moved to BBC World and BBC News 24 as a news anchor. In 2006 he joined CNN as an anchor and correspondent fronting daily editions of World News, CNN Today and Business International. Finighan regularly fronted ‘on-location’ CNN coverage of live events and globally significant stories such as the Heathrow Airport ‘terror plot’, the Madrid ‘train bombers’ trial and the global financial crisis. In September 2010 Finighan relocated to Doha, Qatar to take up a post with the Al Jazeera Network. He joined a team of established presenters fronting bulletins in English language channel.

data.name: Zein Elabadin Tawfik Ragab
data.bio: Zein is a Principal News and Programs Anchor at Al Jazeera TV Channel, boasting over 30 years of experience as a journalist, writer, radio anchor, and TV presenter. He began his career with Egyptian daily newspapers and international news agencies in Cairo Authority/Corporation in the late 1990s, serving as an editor and news and programs presenter/anchor until 2012. Subsequently, he joined the BBC Arabic TV service in 2010, where he presented news and programs such as 'Agenda Maftouha' (An Open Agenda), 'Sa’at Hisab', and 'Liqa’a'. Later, he transitioned to Al Jazeera Mubashir, hosting a talk show program that became Egypt's main program on Al Jazeera Mubashir Misr/Egypt.
data.experience: - From 1991 to 1999, he served as an Editor for Reuters and German news agencies in Cairo. - Between 1993 and 1999, he was part of the Arabic section of the British Broadcasting Corporation. - Over the course of his professional career, he has conducted field news coverage in Iraq, Yemen, Syria, Turkey, Tunisia, Egypt, Morocco, and Libya. - He is a certified trainer at the training sections of both the BBC and the Al Jazeera Media Institute. - Additionally, he has conducted training courses for journalists and media professionals in numerous Arab countries.

data.name: Ayman Azzam
data.bio: Ayman Azzam began his media career about three decades ago when he joined the Egyptian television team as a news anchor and program presenter. At the beginning of the third millennium, he joined several satellite channels in Egypt, including Al-Mehwar satellite channel, where he presented some talk shows. Later, he moved to Sharjah Radio and Television as a presenter before joining Al Jazeera Media Network in 2011, where he continues to serve in the same capacity. Ayman Azzam's experience in training television news presentation and talk show presentation spans 30 years. During this time, he worked with various institutions, training numerous individuals in the fields of media and human development. He offers a variety of accredited training courses at Al Jazeera Media Institute, including Introduction to Television Presentation, Television Talk Show Presentation, and Media Skills courses.
data.experience: 1. Presenter and program presenter on Egyptian television in 1994. 2. Presenter at Sharjah Radio and Television in 2011. 3. Presenter at Al Jazeera Mubasher since 2011. 4. He hosts a weekly program from Sunday to Thursday on Al Jazeera Mubasher (after midnight since 2020). 5. He won the title of the best Arab broadcaster in a (Rassd) media institution poll in 2021 for the program 'After Midnight' on Al Jazeera Mubasher.

data.name: Ali Hassan JM Al-Mosllamani
data.bio: Ali Al-Mosllamani born in Doha. He began his media career in 2003, commenting on Qatar TV. He was then the youngest Arab commentator, where he was only 19 years old at the time. He covered the Asian Cup in China in 2004 as the youngest media player in the tournament as well as covering the Gulf Cup in Doha, crowned by the Qatari team. He then moved to Al Kass Sports Channels, one of its members since its inception, and commented on many sporting events locally and internationally, in conjunction with his chairmanship of editing the program of our children in cooperation with Aspire Academy of Sports Excellence "Aspire Dome". Al-Mosllamani also holds an accredited diploma from Al Jazeera Center for Training and Media Development in preparing, presenting and directing radio programs where he worked for six years in "Radio Sawt Al-Khaleej" as a presenter of sports programs and news. Al-Mosllamani moved to Al Jazeera in 2008 and was the only Qatari in the newsroom where he worked as a journalist and then as an assistant producer before becoming a certified sports news producer starting December 2012. Ali has a course in media management and planning, management of newsrooms, human resource management from Cambridge. He provided several media courses in Qatar News Agency, Qatar University and the Qatar Olympic Academy. He also held the position of the General Supervisor and member of the jury in the Future Media competition, one of the activities of the Organizing Committee for Qatar National Day.
data.experience: A sports commentator on football matches in Qatar TV, and Al-Douri and Al-Kass channels from 2011-2003. Presenter of sports news and analytical studios at Qatar TV and Al-KASS channel since 2005. Head of the Sports Section at Sout Al Kaleej Radio and is the Preparer and Presenter of sports and news programs from 2013 – 2003. Preparer and Presenter of the show Pelenties. Producer – Edito in Chief of the program "Eyalna" in cooperation with Aspire Academy (3 years).

data.name: Ahmed yousef Al Malki
data.bio: He is a presenter and programmer for Qatar TV and media skills trainer for Al-Jazeera Media Institute and e-Learning for youth and children. He also trains youth on mass communication techniques and communication skills. In addition, he contributed to providing valuable workshops for children and youth with different entities. He is proficient in speaking and writing skills in addition to preparing TV and radio programs, as well as his contributions in presenting the various public events, celebrations and seminars since 2000 till date.
data.experience: • Division Director, Quality Management & Editorial Standards, Al Jazeera Network (2012 - present) • News Planning Director & Head of Foreign Offices and Correspondents, Al Jazeera Arabic Channel (2012-2010). • Managing Editor of Al Jazeera Net website in Al-Jazeera Network (2010-2001). • Head of International Affairs Department in Al-Sharq Qatari newspaper (1999 to 2001).

data.name: Nadim Al- Mallah
data.bio: Presenter Nadim Al-Mallah played a key role in establishing Al Jazeera's economic department and has been serving as a presenter for economic bulletins and programs since joining the network in 2001. In recognition of his outstanding contributions, he was honored with the Mohamed Amin Award for Economic Journalism in 2009 at the Arab Media Forum. Al-Mallah strongly believes in the transformative power of technology in journalism and actively incorporates innovative tools into his storytelling. He has leveraged his expertise in drone photography, emerging as one of the leading experts in this field. Recognizing the importance of sharing his knowledge, he has taken on the role of a certified trainer at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, specializing in mobile journalism and aerial photography training.
data.experience: Nadim Al-Mallah served as the editor and presenter of economic bulletins at Jordan TV from 2000 to 2001. Since 2001, he has been an integral part of Al Jazeera's economic department, serving as both a presenter and producer. His significant contributions played a key role in establishing and expanding the Al Jazeera economic section, increasing its visibility on the network's screen. He hosted the program 'Economy and People,' dedicated to shedding light on how economic conditions impact people's lives, providing them with a platform to discuss their living conditions.

data.name: Laila Al-shaikhli
data.bio: Laila Al-Sheikhly, a distinct bright media figure in the Arab media space. She is a graduate of Pittsburgh University – America, and the first female presenter who presents a political program on Arab satellite channels. She began her career working for ANA Channel, America in 1991, and then moved between a considerable numbers of Arab media channels and TVs, before joining Al Jazeera Arabic Channel. In 2014, she joined al-Arab TV “project”, which broadcasted for only one day with the company of the late journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Then she returned back to Al Jazeera Arabic Channel, where she works now as a principal anchor. During her career in the media, she presented a bouquet of successful talk shows such as: “Agenda” and “Dialogue with the West” on MBC screen, and “Dunya” and “Panorama” on Abu Dhabi satellite Channel. At Aljazeera Arabic Channel she presented “Beyond the News”, in addition to covering several important events such as: Israel's withdrawal from south Lebanon, 9/11tragic event. She made a lot of interviews with most prominent political figures such as the late leader Nelson Mandela, Colonel Muammar Gaddafi, and the late Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik Hariri.
data.experience: Laila Al Sheikhly has more than 30 years of experience working with ANA- USA, BBC, MBC and Abu Dhabi Channel in the United Arab Emirates, Al Arab Channel in Bahrain and Al Jazeera Arabic Channel in Qatar. In addition to her current career on screen she is an accredited trainer with Aljazeera Media Institute, where she trainees hundreds of trainees on a considerable number of media courses such as: Meeting the media skills, the Art of addressing public, as well as TV news presentation & TV talk shows presentation and “A project for Charisma”.

data.name: Asef Hamidi
data.bio: Since joining Al Jazeera Arabic in 2005, Asef has worked in its main newsroom as a Producer, Executive Producer, Output Manager, and since 2015, the Director of News. Before joining Al Jazeera Asef was the Chief Editor at Abu Dhabi News Channel from 2005-2000, and covered hot spots around the world, including Afghanistan, Iraq, Palestine, Iran, Lebanon, South Africa and the Philippines. Asef was Head of News for the Palestinian Broadcasting Corporation when it launched in 1993, and also covered Palestinian affairs for a number of regional and global stations. He was the General Manager of Amwaj radio station in Palestine in the ‘90s, and worked as a freelance correspondent with Associated Press in Jordan and Yemen. Asef is also a trainer at Al Jazeera Media Training Institute. He has written three books: • Radio and TV Journalism: The Keys to Success and Secrets to Creativity (taught in several Arab journalism schools) • Writing to Picture • A Field Guide for TV Correspondents
data.experience: 13 years in Al Jazeera news Channel working as News Supervisor and Editing Director. 5 years as an Editor-in-chief in Abu Dhabi. 5 years as TV Reporter for a number of television channels and radios like Dubai TV and Abu Dhabi radio.

data.name: Ahmed Al Sheikh
data.bio: A veteran journalist who was born a year after Palestine’s catastrophe in 1948. He spent his childhood and teenage years in the village of Jammein, southwest of the city of Nablus where his ancestors settled after they emigrated from Morocco as pilgrims. Though he spent the greater part of his life as an expatriate in the Arab world, hoping to return one day, he is still unable to reconcile a bitter feeling of alienation with an intrinsic belief in Arab Unity.
data.experience: -Teacher of English in Jordan and Kuwait 1972. -Experience as journalist: 1976-now: started as freelance translator and script writer in Kuwait TV and ALQABAS and ALNBA dailies. -Became full time journalist in 1980 and in 1984 took over as editor of “ALBURAQ” aviation and inflight magazine till 1990. -Joined the BBC Arabic TV in 1994 as senior producer till 1996 when the service was closed. -Joined ALJAZEERA in June 1996 and in 2004 took over as Editor-in-Chief till late 2010 when he became advisor to the Chairman of the Board. -Launched ALJAZEERA.NET as Chief Editor IN 2000. -Launched ALJAZEERA English website ALJAZEERA.COM in 2004 and was its first Managing Editor. -Anchored ALJAZEERA first live talk show “ALSHARIA WA ALHAYA” 1996- 1997. -Produced and presented 18 episodes of ALJAZEERA Arabic documentary ALSHAHID. -Anchored “MURASILOON” programme for several years. -Covered many events in several countries and occasions.
data.education: B.A English. The University of Jordan 1972.

data.name: Gamal Almolky
data.bio: Gamal Almolky is one of the most prominent coaching experts in the Arab world. He has been leading the training of trainers at the Al Jazeera Media Institute since 2013, where he has worked on qualifying a large number of specialists in various fields, training them on how to pass on their skills and transfer their inspiring experiences to others. He has graduated hundreds of trainers, including some stars of the Al Jazeera Media Network, and professional trainers from different institutions. In addition to his work in the field of training, Almolky is one of the most prominent specialists in the art of investigative journalism. He is involved in the preparation and presentation of the program 'The Detective,' an investigative program aired on Al Jazeera.
data.experience: Gamal Almolky has accumulated rich experience in designing and building training programs and courses through his work as a trainer and as a writer of training guidance in collaboration with several international organizations. He offers a number of specialized training courses at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, such as a presentation skills course and a training specialist course for both public and governmental and non-governmental agencies.

data.name: RAED ABED
data.bio: Editor and sports program presenter for Al-Jazeera News channel from 1999 to 2003. One of the founders of the Al-Jazeera Sports channel. Mr. Abed is an expert in preparing and presenting TV reports, along with an experience as a sports commenter. Head of the reporters section from 2003 to 2012. He attended several specialized courses in Tunisia, Jordan, Oman and Egypt. He also attended various courses at Al Jazeera Training Center at the correspondents - Section - the fundamentals of investigative journalism - corporate leadership as well as training the trainers courses.
data.experience: News anchor and programs presenter - News and programs editor.

data.name: Muwafaq Faeq Tawfiq
data.bio: Mawafak Faik Tawfik was born in Iraq, Diyala province. He moved to the United Kingdom in the seventies, where he spent most of his life studying, learning and working in the field of translation, journalism and teaching in the university. Mawafk is married and father of 3 children, a girl and two young men. In summer 2000, he moved to the State of Qatar, where he joined Al Jazeera in the beginning as journalist, and then a full time interpret. Mawafak was the first interpret in Al Jazeera, further, he became the head of translation before closing of the section. Tawfik is best known for his voice in the coverage of important events such as the second Intifada, invasion of Afghanistan, Iraq colonization, Lebanon and Gaza wars and others. His translation and his voice became a hallmark of Al Jazeera in the Arab and Islamic world and often known as the “Voice of Al Jazeera.”
data.experience: Decades of experience in the interpretation, training and program development and contributer to the specialized scientific conferences.

data.name: Dr. Hossam Wahbah
data.bio: Dr. Hossam is a specialist in documentary filmmaking and training. He began his career at the Academy of Film and Television in Munich, Germany. He has worked as a documentary film trainer at the Al Jazeera Media Institute and has delivered lectures on documentary filmmaking and drama in Palestine, as well as teaching documentary film in Germany. He has received two documentary film awards in Germany. Currently, he is a senior supervisor in the Quality and Editorial Standards sector. Dr. Hossam is the author of the book 'Documentary Filmmaking' and oversaw the editing of the book 'Television Journalism in Al Jazeera's Experience.'
data.experience: 1994-1995: Academy of Film and Television in Munich, Germany. 2006-2013: Documentary film trainer at Al Jazeera Media Institute. 2006-2008: Instructor of documentary film and drama at Al-Aqsa University, Palestine. 2012-2013: Instructor of documentary film at Weimar University, Germany. 2013-2018: Head of the Training Programs Department at the Al Jazeera Media Training and Development Center. 2018-present: Senior Supervisor in the Quality and Editorial Standards sector. Author of the book 'Documentary Filmmaking' for the Al Jazeera Media Institute.
data.education: 1996-2001 Diploma in documentaries Mainz / Germany; 2004-2006 Master in media drama/ documentaries Stuttgart / Germany; 2009-2012 PhD in Symphony documentaries in the new realism Weimar / Germany University

data.name: Haji Jabir Abubeker
data.bio: An Eritrean novelist and writer, whose novels have won wide acclaim, Hajji Jaber has a number of published works. His novel 'Samrawit' won the Sharjah Award for Arab Creativity in 2012, while 'Marsa Fatima' was published in 2013 and translated into Italian. He has also authored other novels such as 'Spindle Game' and 'Black Foam,' which won the Katara Award for Arabic Narrative in 2019, as well as 'Rambo the Abyssinian.' Currently, Hajji Jaber is collaborating with a group of Eritrean writers on a novelistic project that focuses on the past and present of Eritrea. The goal is to reveal the cultural heritage of the country to the world in an attempt to lift it out of cultural isolation and establish its presence on the world cultural map.
data.experience: Trainer and novelist Hajji Jaber has accumulated rich experience in the field of literary writing, and his novels have won a number of important awards. Hajji conducts courses focusing on the art of literary writing and novel writing skills at the Al Jazeera Media Institute.

data.name: Eyad AlDaoud
data.bio: Eyad Al Daoud has worked in the field of TV direction, production, and channel management since 1994. He started his training career at Al Jazeera Media Institute in 2005, specializing in fields such as documentary filmmaking, mobile film production, and mobile photography. His work has won 18 different awards and honors, the most recent of which was the Golden Award at the Radio and Television Festival. He has several published books dealing with the arts of program planning and production, as well as publishing a biography titled 'Eyad Al Daoud: A Journey in Search of an Identity' by critic Bashar Ibrahim.
data.experience: 2007 – 2012: Deputy General Manager at Al Shorouk TV, Dubai Media City. 2004 – 2007: Head of Production Section at Al Jazeera Documentary Channel. He supervised the production of approximately 200 hours of documentaries and investigations, as well as 1000 hours of drama and programs. data.name: Glen Mulcahy
data.bio: Glen Mulcahy is the Founder of Titanium Media and Director of Mojofest Ltd. A former Head of Innovation in the Technology division of RTÉ, the Irish National Broadcaster. He has worked in the broadcast industry for 20 years. In 2009 he started training journalists in mobile journalism. (The use of smartphones for high quality content production) To date he has trained over 2000 journalists around Europe, the Nordics, the Middle East and the US. In 2015 he founded “Mojocon” the first international mobile journalism conference which drew 350 journalists from around the world together in Dublin for 2 days to listen and learn from 50 pioneers who have pushed the boundaries of what you can achieve with mobile for professional content creation. After leaving RTÉ in December 2017 he started Mojofest Ltd to run a new annual mojo conference (Mojofest) and to offer unique “Learning on the go” mojo training tours. Glen has spoken at numerous international conferences on the subjects of mobile journalism and drones including IBC Conference, EBU News Assembly, Aljazeera Forum, News Rewired, Circom Regional annual conference, OI2 Barcelona, and many more. Aside from training several hundred staff in RTÉ he has notably trained staff from BBC, NRK, SVT, YLE, TVP, France2, Aljazeera, Symantec, Oracle and others. He is interested in Technology, Innovation and Futurism.

data.name: Imad Bahjat
data.bio: Imad is considered one of the most prominent pioneers in television directing, with extensive experience in the field of TV and media. He began his career in 1972 and has worked on numerous and diverse projects, including drama series, plays, political and religious programs, news shows, as well as various talk shows and educational programs. He has also directed many music videos for prominent Iraqi and Arab artists. His documentaries have been broadcast on major international channels, including CNN, as well as on leading Arab television networks. Imad has won numerous awards at significant Arab festivals, such as the second and third Gulf Festivals in Kuwait, and has served as a jury member in several prominent Gulf festivals. He is regarded as a major figure who has enriched Iraqi and Arab television with a vast body of work that remains memorable to viewers to this day. Many prominent Arab media figures have trained under him, and he continues to train technical staff in television directing techniques. The Arab League honored him at the Festival and Forum of Arab Pioneers and Innovators for his artistic career.

data.bio: Data journalist and instructor, he leads Al Jazeera's interactive team, @AJLabs, where he uses data to tell compelling visual and analytical stories. He is the co-founder of PalestineRemix.com, a multimedia rich website available in four languages (English, Arabic, Turkish and Bosnian) for narrating the Palestinian-Israeli story. His main focus is finding interesting ways to tell human stories hidden within data.

data.name: Abdallah Elbinni
data.bio: Abdullah Al-Binni is an executive producer at Al Jazeera Media Network, boasting over 30 years of experience in the television and journalism industry. With a diverse background spanning newsrooms, editing suites, and on-the-ground news and war coverage, he brings a wealth of expertise to his role. Throughout his career, Abdullah Al-Binni has garnered numerous international awards in the fields of photography and documentary production. Notable accolades include the Best Documentary Award for 2007 from the International Broadcasting Corporation in London for his film 'Prisoner 345', the Best Investigative Film Award for 2012 from the Arab States Broadcasting Union, Broadcast Middle East Magazine for his film 'Imam and the Colonel', and most recently, the Final Nomination Award from the New York Film and Television Festival 2020 for his series 'War Hotels'.
data.experience: Abdullah Al Bunni joined Al Jazeera Media Network in 2004 and has since produced numerous programs and documentaries. He currently serves as an executive producer for Al-Marssad on Al Jazeera Arabic and for the documentary series 'Hotels of War' on Al Jazeera English. He has been involved in various stages of program management and production within the network. His career began at an early age, working alongside his father in their private photography studio in the southern Lebanese city of Saida. In 1987, he commenced his work as a photojournalist, collaborating with international news agencies towards the end of the Lebanese civil war. Later, he transitioned to become a news television cameraman with Future TV in Beirut upon its establishment in 1992. By 1996, he had moved to the News Center of Abu Dhabi TV, where he served as a news photographer, editor, and subsequently as a documentary filmmaker. Abdullah has produced investigative documentaries in conflict and war zones he covered, including the massacres against Muslims in Bosnia in 1999, the U.S. war in Afghanistan in 2001, the 2003 invasion of Iraq, and the 2006 Israeli July War against Lebanon. In 2022, he authored a book titled 'Hotels of War', adding to his achievements, which include winning several international awards in the field of documentary production.

data.name: Folly Bah Thibault
data.bio: Folly Bah Thibault is a journalist and Principal Presenter for Al Jazeera English, based in Doha, Qatar. She joined the network in 2010, having previously worked at the French news channel, France24 in Paris and Voice of America in Washington D.C. Folly has covered some of the world’s biggest news stories including the 2004 tsunami, which devastated the southern regions of Asia, and the historic campaign and election of Barack Obama as president of the United States in 2008.
data.experience: As one of the Senior Anchors, Folly has been part of Al Jazeera’s stated goal of giving a ‘voice to the voiceless’ and setting the international news agenda. In 2010, when the Arab world began a series of protests which became known as the ‘Arab Spring’, Folly and her colleagues were there to cover every angle of the story. From the streets of Tunisia, which sparked the revolution, to Cairo’s Tahrir square, and to the battlefields of Libya, Yemen, and of course the continuing crisis in Syria. Folly has also hosted some of Al Jazeera’s most important specials and award-winning programs, including the first-ever debate of candidates to the post of UN Secretary-General in July 2016 and the Nobel Peace Prize Interview in Oslo in December 2016 She has interviewed some of the world’s top leaders, news-makers, and other influential people for Talk To Al Jazeera. These include Kenya’s president Uhuru Kenyatta, the French far-right leader Marine Le Pen, and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Kailash Satyarthi.

data.name: Ibrahim Helal
data.bio: Ibrahim is a professional media figure with over 25 years of extensive experience in global media organizations, including renowned channels such as Egyptian Television, BBC, Abu Dhabi TV, and Al Jazeera Network. His career path reflects a variety of roles, ranging from journalism to editorial leadership and strategic management. He has excellent report writing skills and a deep understanding of media dynamics, in addition to his leadership role.
data.experience: 1.In 1994, he moved to London to participate in a BBC television project, which lasted for only two years before most of the team moved to establish Al Jazeera channel in Qatar in 1996. 2.He was a producer for the bulletins during the establishment of Al Jazeera, then launched the 'Hasad Al Yawm' bulletin in November 1997. 3.In 1999, he worked for a year at BBC Arabic Radio, then in 2000, he worked for another year as the news director for Abu Dhabi TV. 4.In 2001, he returned to Al Jazeera again and was the news director during the events of September, the Afghan war, the second Intifada, and the Iraq war. From April 2004 to May 2006, 5.He supervised a training project at BBC funded by the British government to train around 250 Arab journalists from 7 Arab countries. 6.In 2006, he participated in the founding and launch of Al Jazeera English channel and was the deputy director of the channel for editorial affairs until January 2010. 7.During the years 2010 and 2011, he oversaw the launch of Al Jazeera Balkans channel in Sarajevo. From November 2011 to April 2015, he was the news director of Al Jazeera during the years of the Arab revolutions. 8.From April 2015 to August 2022, he worked as an advisor in the office of His Excellency Sheikh, Chairman of the Board of Al Jazeera. And from August 2022 until now, he works as the editor-in-chief of Al Jazeera English channel.

data.name: Jasem Al-Azawi
data.expertise: News Anchoring, Political Analysis, Media Training
data.bio: Jasem Al-Azawi joined Al Arab News Channel as news anchor and presenter of the “Last Word”, a weekly political show. When Aljazeera English was launched on Nov. 2006, he presented a weekly political show called “Inside Iraq”. For five years the show tackled one of the most complex and multi-layered political crises of his times, the war on Iraq. The show interviewed senior American, Iraqi and European decision-makers and discussed the politico-military and social issues gripping Iraq. Through town hall meetings in Washington, Cairo, and Amman the show also served as a platform for interaction between politicians, analysts, and ordinary people. The show is viewed by media commentators as one of the best sources for creative analyses, controversial viewpoints and insightful debates of opposing opinions. For over ten years he taught at Aljazeera Media institute aspiring presenters as well as seasoned ones. Courses included new presentation, talk show hosting and how to deal with the media. Students also included government officials, businessmen and social activists.
data.experience: In 2003, Jassim covered the events following the occupation of Iraq for six weeks through public programs, news bulletins and field coverage. He also conducted many interviews with world leaders and Arab politicians, and also covered the Israeli withdrawal from southern Lebanon in 2000 and contributed to covering the September eleventh bombings through direct field reports from scratch in New York. He worked as an executive producer for the program 'Dunia' at Abu Dhabi TV, which was a daily magazine for two hours between 2001-2003, and worked as an executive supervisor at MBC station. In London between 1996-1999 for two major programs on the channel, 'Dialogue with the West' and 'Agenda'.

data.bio: Meriem Belalia has been an anchor for news and political programs at Al Jazeera since 2010, where she presents news bulletins and hosts talk shows. Over the years, she has participated in live coverage of various Arab and international events and engaged in field reporting in Yemen, Syria, Libya, Sudan, Thailand, and Mauritania. Meriem has conducted interviews with political figures, officials, ministers, as well as heads of state and government for special programs and news coverage. In addition to her anchoring responsibilities, Meriem also serves as a trainer at the Al Jazeera Media Institute, delivering training courses in Morocco, Tunisia, and Mauritania. Her extensive experience has equipped her with strong skills in handling urgent coverage and managing lengthy conversations with multiple guests.

data.name: Michael Rickwood
data.bio: Initially a classically trained actor with 12 years of experience on stage and screen, Michael swapped his passion for acting in favour of business communication and design in 2011. Today, apart from consulting, training and coaching executives from all sectors and industries all over the world including Engie South East Asia in Singapore, French Search Engine Qwant in Paris and the World Bank in Washington DC, Michael also coaches speakers at hugely successful TEDx and WikiStage conferences. Michael has also coached many start-ups, notably for Microsoft Accelerator, Numa Sprint and Business France, and teaches presentation skills at Celsa-Sorbonne both in English and in French. Michael still takes to the stage himself, but instead of acting, he delivers entertaining keynotes and acts as Master of Ceremonies for company events most recently for Vivatech Paris in 2019 and is also booked for 2021. Michael also teaches at HEC Paris and has worked for HEC Doha in Qatar.

Al-Najjar is also recognized as a certified trainer in digital journalism.

From March 2010 to December 2014, worked as a full-time correspondent for Al Jazeera Net and as an employee of the Al Jazeera Network. He has conducted numerous specialized training programs across 14 Arab and foreign countries. Additionally, Sameer Shamaileh has played a pivotal role as the clerical officer for several works, including 'Al Jazeera: A Success Story' (2011) and 'Al Jazeera Tells Its Story: Experiences and Challenges' (2021).

He supervised the Initiatives and Projects Program at Al Jazeera, within the Channel’s Director Office, in 2017.
